articles.headline: For Asian Americans Wary of Attacks, Reopening Is Not an Option
articles.snippet: Facing a wave of animosity, many Asian Americans remain afraid of public places even as the coronavirus pandemic recedes.
articles.abstract: Facing a wave of animosity, many Asian Americans remain afraid of public places even as the coronavirus pandemic recedes.
articles.lead_paragraph: Millions of Americans may be leaping into a summer of newly unmasked normalcy. But inside Mandy Lin’s apartment in Philadelphia’s Chinatown neighborhood, the lockdown drags on.

articles.headline: Senate Overwhelmingly Passes Bill to Bolster Competitiveness With China
articles.snippet: The wide margin of support reflected a sense of urgency among lawmakers in both parties about shoring up the technological and industrial capacity of the United States to counter Beijing.
articles.abstract: The wide margin of support reflected a sense of urgency among lawmakers in both parties about shoring up the technological and industrial capacity of the United States to counter Beijing.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate overwhelmingly passed legislation on Tuesday that would pour nearly a quarter-trillion dollars over the next five years into scientific research and development to bolster competitiveness against China.

articles.headline: Biden Ends Infrastructure Talks With Republicans, Falling Short of a Deal
articles.snippet: After weeks of failed efforts to bridge deep divides, the president pulled the plug, turning to a bipartisan group to try to salvage a chance at compromise.
articles.abstract: After weeks of failed efforts to bridge deep divides, the president pulled the plug, turning to a bipartisan group to try to salvage a chance at compromise.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden on Tuesday ended a weekslong effort to reach a deal with Senate Republicans on an expansive infrastructure plan, cutting off negotiations that had failed to persuade them to embrace his bid to pour $1 trillion into the nation’s aging public works system and safety-net programs.

articles.headline: How Long Should It Take to Give Away Millions?
articles.snippet: The promise of philanthropy was that the wealthy could enjoy tax breaks for their charitable contributions. The pandemic laid bare how accumulation can trump getting money to those in need. A Senate bill aims to change that.
articles.abstract: The promise of philanthropy was that the wealthy could enjoy tax breaks for their charitable contributions. The pandemic laid bare how accumulation can trump getting money to those in need. A Senate bill aims to change that.
articles.lead_paragraph: The billionaires, former government officials and academics gathered in a Manhattan conference room to brainstorm solutions to a problem they had all been working on from various angles: how best to update the laws governing philanthropy, most of which were half a century old.
